intro: Ampelocissus aesculifolia, commonly known as the rock fig, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Moraceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces edible fig-like fruits that are typically green when mature. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its adaptability makes it a useful plant for erosion control and as a source of food for wildlife.
